results.title: Australian diary. No. 105
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and Jack S. Allan
results.brief_description: The following items are featured in this interesting cinemagazine: welfare clinics aid children in New Guinea; trained dolphins eat lunch from keeper’s hands and experiments are tried to streamline the sugar cane industry.

results.brief_description: The following items are featured in this interesting cinemagazine: an insight into the art of the furrier; life saving serum is milked from deadly snakes as an antidote to snake-bite and a modern farm is run by a group of Mission Sisters.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 100
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and Jack S. Allan
results.brief_description: The centenary issue of this interesting Cinemagazine is devoted to Australia’s native fauna: the kangaroo, the marsupial cat, the almost extinct Tasmanian Devil, the ibis, emu and other creatures.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 099
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and Jack S. Allan
results.brief_description: Magazine items: At Broken Bay (N.S.W.), the Supervisor of Music, Dept. of Education conducts a camp to give music teachers practical training; poor hardwood country at Woolgoolga is being re-afforested with more valuable pines; a learn to swim campaign in Sydney teaches youngsters to take care of themselves in the water.
